com.fluidops.fedx.evaluation.iterator

Class QueueCursor<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • info.aduna.iteration.CloseableIterationBase<E,X>
      • info.aduna.iteration.LookAheadIteration<E,org.openrdf.query.QueryEvaluationException>
        • com.fluidops.fedx.evaluation.iterator.QueueCursor<E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    info.aduna.iteration.CloseableIteration<E,org.openrdf.query.QueryEvaluationException>, info.aduna.iteration.Iteration<E,org.openrdf.query.QueryEvaluationException>

    public class QueueCursor<E>
extends info.aduna.iteration.LookAheadIteration<E,org.openrdf.query.QueryEvaluationException>
    Makes working with a queue easier by adding the methods done() and toss(Exception) and automatically converting the exception into a QueryEvaluationException with an appropriate stack trace.
    Author:
    James Leigh

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      QueueCursor(int capacity)
      Creates an QueueCursor with the given (fixed) capacity and default access policy.
      QueueCursor(int capacity, boolean fair)
      Creates an QueueCursor with the given (fixed) capacity and the specified access policy.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkException() 
      void done()
      Indicates the method put(Object) will not be called in the queue anymore.
      E getNextElement()
      Returns the next item in the queue or throws an exception.
      void handleClose() 
      void put(E st)
      Adds another item to the queue, blocking while the queue is full.
      void toss(java.lang.Exception exception)
      The next time LookAheadIteration.next() is called this exception will be thrown.

    • Constructor Detail

      • QueueCursor

        public QueueCursor(int capacity)
        Creates an QueueCursor with the given (fixed) capacity and default access policy.
        Parameters:
        capacity - the capacity of this queue

      • QueueCursor

        public QueueCursor(int capacity,
           boolean fair)
        Creates an QueueCursor with the given (fixed) capacity and the specified access policy.
        Parameters:
        capacity - the capacity of this queue
        fair - if true then queue accesses for threads blocked on insertion or removal, are processed in FIFO order; if false the access order is unspecified.

    • Method Detail

      • toss

        public void toss(java.lang.Exception exception)
        The next time LookAheadIteration.next() is called this exception will be thrown. If it is not a QueryEvaluationException or RuntimeException it will be wrapped in a QueryEvaluationException.

      • put

        public void put(E st)
         throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Adds another item to the queue, blocking while the queue is full.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • done

        public void done()
        Indicates the method put(Object) will not be called in the queue anymore.

      • getNextElement

        public E getNextElement()
                 throws org.openrdf.query.QueryEvaluationException
        Returns the next item in the queue or throws an exception.
